data.text: What bag options do you have? Besides panniers and backpack, only other option I can think of is a big enough handlebar bag. Latter is what I'd probably use of I get a laptop. And to the people saying you don't need it, you don't know this person's needs. If I get one it would be for photo and video editing on trips too long to just wait to return home from editing. Plenty successful tourers do this.

data.text: I carry an iPad mini. In an Eylar hard-shell camera case set up as a trunk box, attached to the platform of the rear luggage rack using pad eye hooks around the rack rails. The small size works for me, but these come larger if you need that for a larger device. Waterproof, shock resistant, lockable. Space atop for a Voltaic Systems 10-watt solar panel to recharge batteries.
